pullRequest.body:
reduces some technical debt by replacing "open scoped classical" with (open scoped classical in) for theorem declarations and/or adding a "classical' tactic to a tactic proof. I followed the example in PR https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20325.  I made the PR smaller than before and concentrated on FieldTheory and GroupTheory files.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (16.00, 0.34)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|47|-16|bare open (scoped) Classical|

Current commit [8b0bba520f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/8b0bba520f12dbee6d2c5aaccb04d0792d7e31f5)
Reference commit [b53998a5b3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/b53998a5b3fad1f750267986708c28bcf5426461)

```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13026244458/job/36335744620)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13026244458/job/36335744333)
Change the open scoped classicals to tactic mode classicals.
This could be a `classical` at the start of the proof. Would you mind reviewing these again?

I can do the following:

noncomputable def length (w : W) : ‚Ñï := by
classical
exact Nat.find (cs.exists_word_with_prod w)

But I was told in a previous PR (I can try to find the comment) that it is better to just "open classical in" before the proof/function signature.  I originally did it this way (changing it to a tactic proof), I can do it either way.
Here is a link to the previous comment https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20501#discussion_r1915662169
@kim-em, I never know how I come across on message boards.  And it always bothers me.  I didn't mean to be dismissive.  I am just looking for guidance.  Thanks for the review.

> Here is a link to the previous comment [#20501 (comment)](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20501#discussion_r1915662169)

I think the comment you linked to can be paraphrased as "turning a term-mode `def` into a tactic-mode `def` (i.e. `def X := by ...`) has disadvantages", since `def`s are often data and tactics can add "junk" to it. If I understand correctly, Kim's comment referred to `theorem exists_reduced_word` (and similar cases), which is both a theorem (for which we have proof irrelevance, so it does not matter if the term produced by the tactic is uglier) and already in tactic mode. What to do with term-mode proofs probably depends on the context, but for tactic-mode proofs it's much more clear-cut.

Thanks Mauricio, that's what I had in mind. For a tactic proof we can/should just use `classical` inside the by block.

@kvanvels, no problem, your intent was understood! :-)

I think I finally figured out why I was confused.  I was thinking @kim-em's comment was directed at the `length_wordProd_le` while it actually was directed at `theorem exists_reduced_word`.  I jumped to a hasty conclusion.  I think I am on the same page now.  Thanks.
This was the only one I needed to fix (believe it or not :+1:) The other ones needed to remain because their "function signatures"  required them.
This needs to be where it is.  The function signature needs to be "classicaled" too.
This needs to stay this way.  Function signature needs classicals, too.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: replace open scoped Classical with open scoped Classical in or classical
